VOL. 2, NO. 18 {Day, Month Date} Back In Season <#editor-welcome> VMware and Pivotal – Stronger Together <#business-update> Pivotal Sets the Tone at SpringOne 2GX <#product-update> Agile Transformation and Teaching Change <#agile-update> APJ – Strategic Hires Help Capture Opportunity <#people-update> Phyllis Davidson <#my-name-is> Welcome to Pivotal! <#new-pivots> EDITOR WELCOME Back In Season Steve Casale <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1033819-stephencasale>, Sr. Manager, Corporate Communications Summer makes its curtain call, and Pivotal takes the stage again. Things are different this time around. As one contributor reports in this issue, the energy coming from a highly successful VMware and Pivotal partnership at VMworld signals an important step for Pivotal.
We may still be shaping a unique proposition, but we’re finding the upside and strength in our partnership with Federation parents EMC and VMware – as opposed to defining ourselves apart from them. Our leadership in the large and lively SpringOne developer community is also on display next week in Dallas (sneak peek below), and the Agile cast gives more proof that its methods are a spark for cultural change.
Pivotal is back in season, and the show is better than ever. Enjoy! BUSINESS UPDATE VMware and Pivotal – Stronger Together Lee Loughnane <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/949149-leeloughnane>, Director, Global Alliances, VMware What a difference a year makes. In the wake of last week’s highly successful Pivotal showing at VMworld <http://www.vmworld.com/index.jspa> in San Francisco, it’s hard to recall that a little over a year ago Pivotal was focused on establishing what made it unique from its Federation <http://emcfederation.com/> parents.
Pivotal spent much of 2014 tilling the potential of this key Federation partnership. The result is strong executive alignment with VMware, a roadmap and investment plan for joint solutions that build upon our shared Cloud Foundry heritage <http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/vmw-newsfeed/VMware-Teams-With-Docker,-Google-and-Pivotal-to-Simplify-Enterprise-Adoption-of-Containers/1872989>, and messaging alignment to market solutions and enable the field to finish strong in 2014 with momentum into 2015.
Our mutual commitments through 2014 include the Focus Account Program, a Pivotal and VMware joint field engagement effort and selling motion for accounts with a high propensity for Pivotal CF on VMware IaaS <http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/vmw-newsfeed/VMware-Unveils-New-vCloud-Air-Mobile-and-Hybrid-Cloud-Services/1872978> – either as on-premise (vSphere) or hybrid deployments (vCloud Air) of Pivotal CF. Pivotal and VMware Americas field teams also have a target number for joint 2H wins and pipeline targets into 2015, with APJ and EMEA setting similar goals.
Last week we saw early dividends when Pivotal marketing, pre-sales, sales, engineering and executive teams joined VMware to create a singular customer experience at VMworld. A record number of visitors (more than 2,300) attended the Pivotal booth presentations <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal/news-2/experience-no-limits-join-pivotal-at-vmware-vmworld-us-2014>, while the joint Pivotal and VMware value proposition resonated throughout the demos, breakouts and keynotes. Capping it off were the over 200 customers and prospects who turned out for the Pivotal-hosted executive reception in San Francisco.
Pivotal Shine (l to r): Packing it in at the Pivotal booth; Paul Maritz welcomes a full house at Pivotal San Francisco office.
We’re just getting started with VMware and you’ll be hearing a lot more about how we’re partnering to win! PRODUCT UPDATE Pivotal Sets the Tone at SpringOne 2GX Andy Clement <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/916812-andyclement>, Engineer, App Fabric R&D On September 8th Pivotal kicks off the SpringOne 2GX conference <http://springone2gx.com/>, where a thousand developers are expected to descend on Dallas, Texas to immerse themselves in the latest on Spring <http://spring.io/>, Groovy <http://groovy.codehaus.org/> and Grails <https://grails.org/>. Building on the Spring IO vision <http://spring.io/platform> we presented last year, Pivotal will showcase Spring IO enhancements around the key themes of micro-service architectures and Big Data.
Micro-service architectures <http://martinfowler.com/articles/microservices.html> are increasingly popular design approaches for developers to rapidly evolve application features, independently. They enable the continuous, iterative development that is the hallmark of Agile. The approach also brings coordination issues, when they call for the intelligent routing of requests, addressing service failures and more. Pivotal will announce Spring Cloud services – ready-to-go, customizable solutions that resolve a number of coordination issues around micro-services. We’ll also showcase a micro-service architecture running on our flagship platform, Pivotal CF.
We’re delighted that Netflix <http://netflix.github.io/#repo> will join us onstage during the keynote to share how they employ Spring Boot on 50% of their new projects!
On the topic of Big Data, attendees will hear more about the recent GA of Spring XD <http://projects.spring.io/spring-xd/>. Building on the strong foundations of Spring Batch <http://projects.spring.io/spring-batch/> and Spring Integration, Spring XD is a unified, distributed and extensible system for data ingestion, real-time analytics, batch processing and export. High-level DSL and out-of-the-box modules can help developers rapidly create Big Data solutions.
We’ll feature Project Reactor <https://github.com/reactor/reactor>, a library for building reactive fast data applications on the Java virtual machine (JVM), which optimizes resource utilization on systems that employ new architectures. We’ll also present the first public demo of Grails 3.0 – custom-made for micro-services development.
Pivotal has much in store for the 8-million strong Spring developer community! AGILE UPDATE Agile Transformation and Teaching Change Michael Kahn <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/948737-michaelkahn>, Director, Business Development, Pivotal Labs When I first walked into the Pivotal Labs office in San Francisco, in May of 2013, I was struck by an atmosphere of innovation. It was palpable. In October of that same year, I too became part of this inspired company when Pivotal acquired Xtreme Labs <http://www.pivotal.io/agile/pivotal-acquires-xtreme-labs>.
I’ve worked closely with clients over the past two years who are at various points on a journey to a new kind of software development. Some, like Uber <http://www.windowsphone.com/en-us/store/app/uber/b905a877-bd55-4ce7-a7aa-467cdc3a21f4>, Facebook <http://www.windowsphone.com/en-us/store/app/messenger/3219d30d-4a23-4f58-a91c-c44b04e6a0c7>, Fitbit <http://www.windowsphone.com/en-us/store/app/fitbit/378ebdb6-f31f-4505-a00d-c460ef22e7ff>, SurveyMonkey <https://itunes.apple.com/ca/app/surveymonkey/id723867634?mt=8> and Pearson – where software is the product – focus on great execution and an outstanding product.
For others though, a move to Agile development is part of a cultural transformation. It’s exciting to work with larger, more established enterprises that fundamentally want to change. Clients such as Intel, Barnes & Noble, and Nordstrom <https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/nordstrom/id474349412?mt=8> look at how we work and are inspired to use agile to cultivate a new workplace.
Whether they’re ready to dip a toe in the water or dive right in, we’ve coached clients into making a transition to Agile: training and helping them hire people, teaching teams test-driven development, managing the agile process and velocity with Pivotal Tracker, or building a sustainable team via pair programming. These companies want a cultural and process transformation, to a workplace that is more transparent, productive, inspiring and fun.
So what does that look like? Transformation can literally mean knocking down cubicles and walls. Below are before and after photos of one client, Nordstrom, and their Seattle offices.
Nordstrom Transformed: From cubicle clutter and barriers (left), to agile teamwork and productivity (right).
We’ve got great business cases on not just what we do, but how we do it. Look to this newsletter in the coming months for deep dives on Pivotal Labs use cases! PEOPLE UPDATE APJ – Strategic Hires Help Capture Opportunity Melissa Ries <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/927431-melissaries>, Vice President, APJ Sales We see clear PaaS and Big Data opportunities in APJ across the sectors of government, finance, manufacturing and telecommunications. This past quarter, we’ve made a number of strategic APJ hires across functions in order to reach and grow this customer base. Here’s a snapshot of how we’ve come together:
- Vanessa Ong <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1072697-vanessaong> joined us from EMC as our first dedicated APJ Pivotal recruiter to lead a concerted recruitment effort. - Shirley Seah <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1051785-shirleyseah>, who joined us from EMC, brings big company experience to cover the Fortune 100 customer base in APJ, based primarily in Singapore and Hong Kong. - Simon Elisha <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1060680-simonelisha> came to us from Amazon Web Services, as CTO and Senior Manager of ANZ Field Engineering. Simon has been up close with customers large and small, and brings a wealth of experience in helping them transition to the cloud. - Tatsuya Matsuo <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1061300-tatsuyamatsuo> joined us as Senior Account Manager in Japan, where his financial services expertise will help us drive strong traction in this vertical. - On the marketing front, Rushenka Perera <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1059023-rushenkaperera> joined us from Oracle as APJ Marketing Director, and is focused on a plan for aggressive market growth. - Minseok Kim <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1060707-minseokkim> joined us in July as Senior Field Engineer from KT NexR, to grow our Data Lake business in Korea. - Yaw Tan <https://gopivotal-com.socialcast.com/users/1053446-yawtan>, who hails from RHB, joined us in Singapore as a Senior Data Scientist.
These key field-oriented hires provide the backbone we need to win big opportunities in this dynamic region. Stay tuned for a view on APJ customers in our next update! MY NAME IS...
